section.name: Introduction
section.p: Splitting file data in small chucks is a common trick to scale data processing when you launch an analysis on a cluster. When you use Eoulsan in distributed mode, Eoulsan automatically split and merge common biological data (FASTQ files and SAM files) using the Hadoop framework with a low overhead. You can also use this strategy to achieve computation parallelization with non-hadoop cluster providing you manually declare in the workflow file when data must be split and merged.

section.name: Spliter step
section.p: This step allow to split data in small chucks.

ul.li: Available: Both local and distributed mode

Input port:
input: data to split (format defined in the parameters)

Output port:
output: split data (format defined in the parameters)

tr.td: Name of the format of the data to split. See below to get the list of the format that can be split

ul.li: Optional parameters: Splitters can have optional arguments to set the splitting method according to the data format
ul.pre: <!-- Split reads step (100,000,000 max entries by file) --> <step id="mysplitterstep" skip="false" discardoutput="false"> <name>splitter</name> <parameters> <parameter> <name>format</name> <value>fastq</value> </parameter> <parameter> <name>max.entries</name> <value>1000000</value> </parameter> </parameters> </step>

section.name: Merger step
section.p: This step allow to merge small chucks of data in a large file.

ul.li: Available: Both local and distributed mode
Input: Data in the format defined in the parameters
Output: Data merged in the same format as the input

tr.td: Name of the format of the data to merge. See below to get the list of the format that can be merged

ul.li: Optional parameters: Mergers can have optional arguments to set the merge method according to the data format
ul.pre: <!-- Merge Sam files step --> <step id="mymergerstep" skip="false" discardoutput="false"> <name>merger</name> <parameters> <parameter> <name>format</name> <value>sam</value> </parameter> </parameters> </step>

section.name: Technical merger step
section.p: This step allow to merge all the data related to the same technical replicates. This step use the RepTechGroup column of the design to define the data to merge.

ul.li: Available: Both local and distributed mode
Input: Data in the format defined in the parameters
Output: Data merged in the same format as the input

tr.td: Name of the format of the data to merge. See below to get the list of the format that can be merged

ul.li: Optional parameters: Mergers can have optional arguments to set the merge method according to the data format
ul.pre: <!-- Merge technical replicates step --> <step id="mytechrepmerger" skip="false" discardoutput="false"> <name>technicalreplicatemerger</name> <parameters> <parameter> <name>format</name> <value>fastq</value> </parameter> </parameters> </step>
